data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward and start from the same place, you can never get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once you take four steps around, you turn around at the same point and turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Starting is any location in front of you. You can take 2 steps on each of the steps 1 to 4 and 4 to 5, or you can take 15 steps in total. So, the answer is Yes.

If you had 1 step, it would return to the starting point, which is 7 steps. If you took 7 steps, 1 step should have amounted to 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If a person has 10 steps left and 10 steps right, turning left is 10 steps right and turn around is 10 steps left. To reverse directions, turn around is 10 steps right and turn around is 10 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around, you’ve taken 7 steps back from where you started. So, the answer is yes.
